abstract: United States Postal Service internal investigation finds employees did not safeguard documents that were part of service's law enforcement arm, and include names, addresses and financial information of people suspected of criminal activities; lack of security could compromise privacy of mail and lead to identification of people suspected of criminal activity or people monitored for national security purposes.
lead_paragraph: Documents including names, addresses and financial information could have been compromised by the Postal Service’s mail cover surveillance program, an investigation found.

headline.main: Postal Service Failed to Protect Personal Data in Mail Surveillance, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Postal Service Is Faulted on Privacy Protections

snippet: Documents including names, addresses and financial information could have been compromised by the Postal Service’s mail cover surveillance program, an investigation found.
